study_plan_entry.title: CCMX Advanced Course 'Advanced X-ray Diffraction Methods for Coatings: strain, defects and deformation analysis of thin films' (CSEM Neuchâtel)

free_text.Learning outcomes: This course uses X-ray Diffraction techniques (XRD) to investigate the structural properties of coatings obtained at different substrate temperatures for different chemical compositions, the stability of different phases using insitu high temperatures, and the composition of layers using RBS (Rutherford Backscattering Spectroscopy) and ERDA (Elastic Recoil Detection Analysis). Understanding the structure of thin films will improve their production.[br/]After introducing basic thin film and HR-XRD characterisation methods, fundamental theory and limitations will be discussed, including examples of films in applications and how their structure influences characteristics. Real samples will be measured. In-house protocols will be presented for establishing reproducible and reliable measurements, and for interpreting stress/strain and defect concentration.[br/]
free_text.Content: [li]Introduction to different X-Ray techniques[br/][li]Introduction to the relationships between physical and structural properties[br/][li]High resolution X-Ray techniques[br/][li]Structural properties [br/][li]Coherent and non coherent scattering[br/][li]Stress[br/][li]Coatings[br/][li]Examples of successful technology transfers using X-Ray techniques[br/]
